question: How can all the text in all the slides be selected in MS PowerPoint?
option1: By clicking Ctrl + A in Slides view
option2: By clicking Ctrl + A in Outline view
option3: By clicking Ctrl + O in Slides view
option4: By clicking Ctrl + S in Outline view
answer: By clicking Ctrl + A in Outline view
explanation: All the text in all the slides can be selected in MS PowerPoint by clicking Ctrl + A in Outline view. All the slides can be selected by clicking Ctrl + A in Slides view.
